alert.note: Alert for Kinney (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 4:03PM CDT until August 22 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bandera, Edwards, Kerr, Kinney, Real and Uvalde. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leakey, Vanderpool, Camp Wood, Reagan Wells, Montell, Garner State Park, Concan, Laguna, Rio Frio, Cline, Blewett, Utopia, Lost Maples State Natural Area, Dabney, Anacacho and Turkey Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
